title: The ratio of ages of X and Y three years ago was 4:5 and that after three years will be 5:6. What is the sum of the ages of x and y? - Quora

response.answer_text: Three years ago age of x=x-3 Three years ago age of y=y-3 According to questions x-3/y-3=4/5 5(x-3)=4(y-3) 5x-15=4y-12 5x-4y=-12+15=3 …(1) Three years after age of x=x+3 Three years after age of y=y+3 According to questions x+3/y+3==5/6 6(x+3)=5(y+3) 6x+18=5y+15 6x-5y=15–18=-3 Equation (1) multiplying by 5 on both side 25x -20y=15 Equation(2) multiplying by 4 on both side 24x-20y=-12 Subtracting eq(1) from(2) x=15-(-12)=15+12=27 6x-5y=-3 6×27–5y=-3 162–5y=-3 -5y=-3–162=-165 y=-165/-5=33 Sum of age x and y=27+33=60 years 1

The ratio of ages of X and Y three years ago was 4:5 and that after three years will be 5:6. What is the sum of the ages of x and y? Solution: (x-3):(y-3) = 4:5, or 5x-15 = 4y-12, or 5x = 4y+3 or 30x = 24y + 18 …(1) (x+3):(y+3) = 5:6, or 6x+18 = 5y+15, or 6x = 5y-3, or 30x = 25y-15 …(2) Equate (1) and (2): 24y+18 = 25y-15, or y = 33 and x = 27. The sum of he ages of X and Y = 60. Answer.
